channel.title: python on overloaded bits
channel.description: Recent content in python on overloaded bits

item.title: Working with Excel in Python
item.description: Working with Excel in Python Import module, create workbook from openpyxl import Workbook wb = Workbook() Create a sheet wb.create_sheet(title='rtr1') Get sheet by name ws1 = wb['rtr1'] Delete a sheet del wb['Sheet'] Display list of sheetnames wb.sheetnames Access a cell in a sheet cell = ws1['A1'] Save workbook to a file wb.save(filename='vrftestreport.xlsx') Sources and references http://www.pythonexcel.com/ https://openpyxl.readthedocs.io/en/stable/usage.html

item.title: Python Virtual Enviroments
item.description: Using mkvirtualenv w/ Python 3 mkvirtualenv --python=/usr/bin/python3 nameOfEnvironment
